quote: Sadly for my wedding plans, I learned that Nestor is a bardash. I envy the men who enjoy his favors. He has always treated me with friendship which I now value more than my old romantic feelings.
quote_letters: SADLY FOR MY WEDDING PLANS I LEARNED THAT NESTOR IS A BARDASH I ENVY THE MEN WHO ENJOY HIS FAVORS HE HAS ALWAYS TREATED ME WITH FRIENDSHIP WHICH I NOW VALUE MORE THAN MY OLD ROMANTIC FEELINGS
chat:
themselves - Reflexive pronoun: "They looked at ____________."
anywhere - Adverb of place: "You can find it ____________."
modifying - Verb in present participle form: "He is ____________ his diet."
onwards - Adverb indicating direction: "From here ____________ we go left."
roadway - Noun referring to a street or road: "The ____________ was covered in snow."
anthem - Noun referring to a patriotic song: "The ____________ played before the game."
parameter - Noun referring to a boundary or limit: "The ____________ of the experiment were clearly defined."
Isfahan - Proper noun referring to a city: "She is planning a trip to ____________."
enjoyed - Past tense verb: "He ____________ the movie last night."
rhythms - Noun indicating a pattern of movement or sound: "The ____________ of the music were infectious."
chieftain - Noun referring to a leader of a tribe or group: "The ____________ oversaw the negotiations."
eleven - Noun referring to the number 11: "There were ____________ people at the party."
British - Adjective indicating something from or related to Great Britain: "The ____________ accent is often admired."
Lehman - Proper noun referring to a company name: "The collapse of ____________ Brothers had a major impact on the financial crisis."
Oswald - Proper noun referring to a person's name: "____________ was the assassin of JFK."
divine - Adjective meaning heavenly or spiritual: "The ____________ intervention was seen as a miracle."
Hirsch - Proper noun referring to a person's name: "____________ is a famous art historian."
oyster - Noun referring to a seafood delicacy: "The ____________ was served with lemon."
utopia - Noun referring to an ideal or perfect society: "His vision of ____________ was unrealistic."
nights - Noun indicating the time period between evening and morning: "The ____________ are getting longer as summer approaches."
downfall - Noun referring to a sudden loss of power or status: "The dictator's ____________ was welcomed by the people."
